New Records: Giancarlo Stanton hit a 417-foot home run, and the Yankees bullpen tossed 13 2/3 innings without allowing an earned run through three games.
Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton clobbered a solo home run in the eighth inning to lift the Yankees to a 3-2, Game 3 win over the Royals
Stanton delivered the Yankees' first hit of the night in the fourth, ripping a bullet double off the left-center field wall to score Juan Soto
The Yankees made it 2-0 in the fifth by manufacturing a run, with a sacrifice bunt from Alex Verdugo and a sacrifice fly by Soto
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Judge said he liked the extra work Stanton put in before the game, including taking batting practice off a pitching machine
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said Stanton is a 'killer' who can focus in big moments and go to a different place mentally
Stanton said this is what he came for, referring to his postseason success, which includes 26 RBIs over his last 24 playoff games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees bullpen made sure the homer stood up, continuing its strong series by tossing 4 ¹/₃ shutout innings in relief of Clarke Schmidt
The game was played at a sellout crowd at Kauffman Stadium, which had been amped up for its first playoff game in nine years
